message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest acute angle-closure glaucoma, which is a contraindication for Epinephrine due to its ability to dilate the pupils. Acetazolamide, Pilocarpine, and Apraclonidine are all used in the treatment of acute angle-closure glaucoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination findings suggest acute angle-closure glaucoma. Epinephrine can exacerbate the condition by causing mydriasis and increasing intraocular pressure, so it should be avoided. Acetazolamide, pilocarpine, and apraclonidine can be used to treat acute angle-closure glaucoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest acute angle-closure glaucoma, which is an emergency. Epinephrine should be avoided as it can exacerbate the condition. Acetazolamide, Pilocarpine, and Apraclonidine are appropriate treatments for acute angle-closure glaucoma.

Acetazolamide, Pilocarpine, and Apraclonidine are treatment options for acute angle-closure glaucoma.

Epinephrine can exacerbate the symptoms by dilating the pupils and increasing the intraocular pressure, so it should be avoided. Acetazolamide, pilocarpine, and apraclonidine can be used to treat acute angle-closure glaucoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest acute angle-closure glaucoma. Epinephrine should be avoided in this patient because it can worsen the condition by dilating the pupil and decreasing aqueous outflow. Acetazolamide, pilocarpine, and apraclonidine can be used to manage the condition.

Acetazolamide can be used to decrease intraocular pressure, Pilocarpine and Apraclonidine can be used to constrict the pupil and improve outflow of aqueous humor.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including mid-dilated and nonreactive pupil, suggest a diagnosis of acute angle-closure glaucoma. Epinephrine is a contraindication in this situation because it can worsen the condition by further dilating the pupil. The other options, including Acetazolamide, Pilocarpine, and Apraclonidine, can be used for treatment.
